intro: Amaranthus tenuifolius, commonly known as slenderleaf amaranth, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its narrow, feather-like leaves and vibrant red or purple flower heads. The plant grows up to 1–2 meters tall and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible seeds. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a popular choice for gardens and agricultural settings.
